(45) 249.26th October, 1945.CABINET.PUBLIC STATEMENTS BY MINISTERS.Note by the Prime Minister.MY attention has been called to several instances in which statements madeby Ministers in public meetings have been represented in the Press as statementsforeshadowing early legislation on matters on which Government decisions havenot yet been reached.Great care must be exercised to avoid making statements of this kind whichmay create awkward positions in the House.Ministers should also avoid promising "White Papers without consulting the Lord President or myself as their publication may give grounds for a demandfor time for their discussion.C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,26th October, 1945.
